item.title: Show HN: Non.io, a Reddit-like platform Ive been working on for the last 4 years
item.description: - Non.io is a Reddit-like platform with an optional subscription.

item.title: Did Reddit just destroy mobile browser access?
item.description: - Reddit is currently conducting an experiment that has disabled the logged-in mobile web experience for some users.

item.title: Edge sends images you view online to Microsoft
item.description: - The new version of the Microsoft Edge browser allows Microsoft to collect data about the images you view online - This feature is turned on by default and cannot be disabled in the browser settings - Microsoft claims this allows them to improve their services and provide better recommendations to users

item.title: Reddit.com appears to be having an outage
item.description: - Reddit.com experienced an outage that lasted for several hours, resulting in users being unable to access the site.

item.title: Ask HN: Alternatives to Reddit
item.description: - A user on Hacker News asked for alternatives to Reddit - Several users suggested different platforms such as Mastodon, Voat, and SaidIt - Some users also mentioned the need for decentralized platforms and the importance of supporting open-source alternatives.

item.title: Fark redesign is now live (2007)
item.description: - Fark site redesign is now live - Users post mixed reactions to the new design - Some users prefer the old design and request an option to switch between the old and new designs.

item.title: The concurrence of three climatic events
item.description: - Three significant climate events are happening simultaneously worldwide.

item.title: Video to video with Stable Diffusion
item.description: - The article provides step-by-step guides for advanced video editing techniques using Stable Diffusion, a deep-learning-based video editing tool.

item.title: US Patent Office proposes rule to make it much harder to kill bad patents
The US government is buying troves of data about Americans
item.description: - The US government has been stockpiling a large amount of sensitive and intimate information on its citizens, as revealed in a declassified report from the Office of the Director of National Intelligence.
